Knyaz Vladimir handed over to the navy Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/knyaz_vladimir_handed_over_to.shtml

Knyaz Vladimir, the fourth Borey-class submarine and the first ship of the Project 955A class, was officially handed over Link: https://www.aoosk.ru/press-center/news/podpisan-priemnyy-akt-atomnoy-podvodnoy-lodki-knyaz-vladimir/ to the navy. It is expected to formally join the Northern Fleet in June 2020.

Construction of the submarine began in July 2012 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2012/07/construction_of_first_project.shtml , although some work appears to have started as early as 2009. Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2009/08/project_955_saint_nicholas.shtml (see a detailed history of construction at the CAST blog Link: https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4041674.html ).

[Navy Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/navy/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/knyaz_vladimir_handed_over_to.shtml#comments ] [May 28, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/knyaz_vladimir_handed_over_to.shtml ]

Construction of PAK DA prototypes Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/construction_of_pak_da_prototy.shtml

According to defense industry sources quoted by TASS Link: https://tass.ru/armiya-i-opk/8561413 , the industry began construction of prototypes of the PAK DA strategic bomber. Construction of the first aircraft is expected to be completed in 2021.

The PAK DA project goes back to 2009, when Tupolev Design Bureau began R&D on the project. In 2011 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2011/12/russia_begins_rd_on_a_new_stra.shtml , the Long-Range Aviation drew its set of requirements for the new aircraft. The contract to develop the plane was signed with the Tupolev Design Bureau in 2014 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2014/02/tupolev_design_bureau_to_work.shtml (other sources Link: https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4039543.html suggest 2017). The current plan Link: https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4039543.html is to build three prototype aircraft and to complete the program of tests in 2023-2025.

[Aviation Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/aviation/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/construction_of_pak_da_prototy.shtml#comments ] [May 26, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/construction_of_pak_da_prototy.shtml ]

Fourth Tundra early-warning satellite is in orbit Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/fourth_tundra_early-warning_sa.shtml

On May 22, 2020 at 10:31 MSK (07:31 UTC), the Air and Space Forces successfully launched a Soyuz-2.1b launcher from the launch pad No. 4 of the launch complex No. 43 of the Plesetsk site. The satellite delivered to the orbit (by a Fregat booster) will join the space-based segment of the early-warning system.

The satellite was designated Cosmos-2546. Its international designation is 2020-031A.

The satellite is the fourth spacecraft of the new early-warning system, known as EKS or Kupol. The first satellite of the system, Cosmos-2510, was launched in November 2015. The second and third, Cosmos-2518 and Cosmos-2541, were launched in May 2017 and September 2019 respectively. Satellites are deployed on Molniya-type highly elliptical orbits and are said to be capable of detecting launches from all potential missile launch areas. The complete system is expected to include ten satellites on HEO and GEO orbits.

[Early warning Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/early_warning/ ] [Space Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/space/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/fourth_tundra_early-warning_sa.shtml#comments ] [May 22, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/05/fourth_tundra_early-warning_sa.shtml ]

A test of Nudol direct-ascent ASAT system Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/a_test_of_nudol_direct-ascent.shtml

A few days ago Russia issued a NOTAM notice Link: https://twitter.com/PararamTadam/status/1248935599232425984?s=20 that suggested that it will conduct a test of the Nudol ASAT system on April 15, 2020. And indeed it did. The missile was launched from the Plesetsk test site.

U.S. Space Command issued a statement Link: https://www.spacecom.mil/MEDIA/NEWS-ARTICLES/Article/2151611/russia-tests-direct-ascent-anti-satellite-missile/ in which is said that it "is aware and tracking Russia's direct-ascent anti-satellite (DA-ASAT) missile test April 15."

Previous Nudol test appears to have taken place in November 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/11/possible_test_of_nudol_from_pl.shtml .

[Space Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/space/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/a_test_of_nudol_direct-ascent.shtml#comments ] [April 15, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/a_test_of_nudol_direct-ascent.shtml ]

New START data as of 1 March 2020 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/new_start_data_as_of_1_march_2_1.shtml

The U.S. State Department released Link: https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/04-01-2020-March-NST-FACTSHEET-Public-Release-of-Aggregate-Data.pdf aggregate New START numbers from the 1 March 2020 data exchange. Russia declared 1326 deployed warheads, 485 deployed launchers, and 754 total launchers. In September 2019 the numbers were Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/10/new_start_data_as_of_1_septemb.shtml 1426, 513, and 757 respectively.

The drop in the number of deployed warheads is quite notable (although not unprecedented), but all it would take is standing down one R-36M2 regiment. Given the change in the number of deployed launcher, it appears that quite a few Topol ICBMs have been withdrawn from service as well.

The U.S. numbers in March 2020 were 1373 warheads, 655 deployed and 800 total launchers (1376, 668, and 800 in September 2019).

Speaking of New START, a few days earlier Russia and the United States agreed to postpone their inspections and the BCC session because of the COVID-19 crisis. They did manage Link: file:///Users/Pavel/Documents/Zotero/storage/NX4DRPWU/new-start-treaty-inspection-activities.html to conduct 2 inspections each since February 5, 2020 (out of the annual quota of 18).

[Arms control Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/arms_control/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/new_start_data_as_of_1_march_2_1.shtml#comments ] [April 2, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/04/new_start_data_as_of_1_march_2_1.shtml ]

Glonass-M launched from Plesetsk Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/03/glonass-m_launched_from_pleset_1.shtml

The Air and Space Forces performed a successful launch of a Soyuz-2.1b rocket from the launch pad No. 4 of the launch complex No. 43 of the Plesetsk space launch site. The launch took place at 21:28 MSK (18:28 UTC) on March 16, 2020. The satellite that the rocket and its Fregat boost stage delivered into orbit is a Glonass-M navigation satellite. The satellite has been designated Cosmos-2545. It received international designation 2020-018A and was registered by NORAD as object No. 45358.

Previous Glonass launch took place in December 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/12/launch_of_a_glonass-m_satellit.shtml .

[Space Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/space/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/03/glonass-m_launched_from_pleset_1.shtml#comments ] [March 16, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/03/glonass-m_launched_from_pleset_1.shtml ]

New Meridian-M satellite is in orbit Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/02/new_meridian-m_satellite_is_in.shtml

On 20 February 2020 at 11:24 MSK (08:24 UTC) the Space Forces successfully launched a Soyuz-2.1a launcher from the launch pad No. 3 of the launch complex No. 43 of the Plesetsk space launch site. The launcher, equipped with a Fregat booster stage, delivered into orbit a new military communication satellite of the Meridian-M type.

The satellite's NORAD number is 45254. Its international designation is 2020-015A. The satellite is known as Meridian 9. Previous Meridian launch took place in July 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/07/meridian_8_satellite_is_the_fi.shtml .

[Space Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/space/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/02/new_meridian-m_satellite_is_in.shtml#comments ] [February 20, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/02/new_meridian-m_satellite_is_in.shtml ]

Life extension for UR-100NUTTH Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/life_extension_for_ur-100nutth.shtml

The ministry of defense asked NPOmash Link: https://tass.ru/armiya-i-opk/7655327 to extend the service life of the UR-100NUTTH/SS-19 missiles, so they could be used as launchers in the Avangard system.

The report says that the last extension, to 36 years, was done in May 2019, but as far as I can tell, this was done in 2014 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2014/06/no_service_life_extension_for.shtml . There were no life-extension reports after that (which doesn't mean that it hasn't been done, though).

In any event, the previous extension was probably quite different from the upcoming one - it was about service life of missiles that have been fueled and deployed. The ones that will be used for Avangard are those 30 "dry" missiles received from Ukraine some time ago. An extension would still be necessary, of course, and my guess is that these missiles have quite a few years in them.

[Rocket Forces Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/rocket_forces/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/life_extension_for_ur-100nutth.shtml#comments ] [January 31, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/life_extension_for_ur-100nutth.shtml ]

Missile launches in 2019 and plans for 2020 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/missile_launches_in_2019_and_p.shtml

According to the press department of the defense ministry Link: https://www.militarynews.ru/story.asp?rid=1&nid=524877&lang=RU , the Strategic Rocket Forces conducted five ICBM launches in 2019 - three from Plesetsk and two from Kapustin Yar. In 2020 the Rocket Forces are planning to conduct six ICBM launches, five of them from Plesetsk.

The two launches from Kapustin Yar are the Topol-E launches on 26 July 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/07/launch_of_topol_from_kapustin_2.shtml and on 28 November 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/11/topol_launch_from_kapustin_yar_5.shtml . The three launches from Plesetsk are the Yars launch from a mobile TEL in February 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/02/yars_launch_from_plesetsk.shtml , the launch of a Topol-M from a silo in September 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/09/silo-based_topol-m_launched_fr.shtml , and the launch of a mobile Yars in October 2019, during the Grom-2019 exercise Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/10/annual_exercise_of_strategic_f_1.shtml .

[Rocket Forces Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/rocket_forces/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/missile_launches_in_2019_and_p.shtml#comments ] [January 7, 2020] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2020/01/missile_launches_in_2019_and_p.shtml ]

Commissioning of Knyaz Vladimir Project 995A submarine delayed Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/12/commissioning_of_knyaz_vladimi.shtml

According to a source in the defense industry Link: https://iz.ru/960189/2019-12-30/istochnik-soobshchil-o-perenose-peredachi-v-sostav-vmf-apl-kniaz-vladimir , Knyaz Vladimir, the fourth Borey-class submarine and the first ship of the Project 955A class, will join the fleet "in the fist half of the year 2020." The submarine was undergoing sea trials, that included a launch of a Bulava missile in October 2019 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/10/first_bulava_launch_from_knyaz.shtml . It was expected Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/09/knyaz_vladimir_project_955a_su.shtml to join the Northern Fleet at the end of 2019.

Construction of Knyaz Vladimir started in 2012 Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2012/07/construction_of_first_project.shtml .

[Navy Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/navy/ ] [Comments (0) Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/12/commissioning_of_knyaz_vladimi.shtml#comments ] [December 30, 2019] [# Link: http://russianforces.org/blog/2019/12/commissioning_of_knyaz_vladimi.shtml ]
